name: YUY2 Video Picture Encoding
extras: <?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?><metadata><field name="disclosure">Is open format.</field><field name="filenameExtension"></field><field name="internetMediaType"></field><field name="pronomPUID"></field></metadata>
description: A digital, color-difference component video picture format identified by the FOURCC code YUY2.  This format employs 4:2:2 chroma subsampling with each sample represented by 8 bits of data.  It is essentially the same as UYVY but with different component ordering packed within the two-pixel macropixel: Byte 0=8-bit Y'0; Byte 1=8-bit Cb; Byte 2=8-bit Y'1; Byte 3=8-bit Cr.
